title: Can a religious blog be profitable? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, and it can be prophetable, too. The rewards are based on worldly rewards as well as heavenly rewards. The situation itself depends on the way that we could promote the blog and use it to create revenue. :So a blog features adverts and gets rewarded that way, or sponsored by others who support us. In some ways, registered charities can set up a donation web page form to process such donations, or we could use the Paypal way that sends payments directly to Paypal registered accounts. So we may see a support us, or support me, link, or a donations web page, somewhere on the blog, or added at the end of each blog post. :Another way, is getting commissions based on partnership links, or affiliation website links. Another way, is merely to set up our own Internet store for merchandise, or just a selection of recommended products here and there. Another way of gaining is getting discount deals with recognised discount or voucher websites, as these have direct discounts, as well as partner discounts to offer.:If we set up a newsletter, or notifications service, then those who visit and register can receive our blog updates, which could include adverts that create revenue. The object of the exercise is firstly to provide revenue for maintaining the existence of the blog, since we pay for computers and printers and Internet expenses and these may also include blog expenses or a domain name service.:I didn't go any of these ways for my poetry blog as all I wanted to do was to provide the text for the poetry rather than surrounding this with adverts, videos and animations... Money wasn't the objective or the priority...:http://denis-martindale.blogspot.com:
